title: Jimmycrooks
author: Jimmycrooks
content: Hi guys, i'm a new user in this forum and I just wanna know, how do I get merits on my post. Is it just by writing or are there any other task involved.Also if there's any other thing I need to know about this forum rules and regulations Maybe, that'd be appreciated. Thank you and happy holidays

comments.author: Nwada001
comments.body: Firstly Welcome to the forum. You should remove this how to get merit on your mind . Just be a good poster, contribute on ways that you can, every one have where they are good at, fine that place that you are good at and specialize on that place. As long as your active and contributive on the forum you will see the merits coming.

comments.author: aysg76
comments.body: Quote from: Jimmycrooks on April 08, 2023, 01:14:00 PMHi guys, i'm a new user in this forum and I just wanna know, how do I get merits on my post. Is it just by writing or are there any other task involved.This is discussion forum so we only make post here taking part in different topics but what else task you have in mind? You only need to share your ideas and thoughts here but that should be on topic having something useful in it to be considered of quality on which basis you will get merits here.There are different threads on the same topic and you can use forum search function but for you it would not come up with nice results so best is to do google search like this way Code: How to rank up and get merits bitcointalkWhat is quality post bitcointalk You will be redirected to all the threads based on this topic and you can take note from them and don't create similar topics as it's not advisable and of low quality.There is topic to help you on this which you can go through to help you learn how to gain merits effectively: Ranking up is possible! 2900 Merits earned in less than 12 months!My 11 Hints!So just make your way but the most important is learning and enhancing your knowledge with time which will at the end give you knowledge to take part in healthy discussions contributing more effectively and of high quality.

comments.body: Just be useful, articulate and make some sense!

comments.author: Dr.Bitcoin_Strange
comments.body: OP, with this being your first thread as a newbie, it's a bit wired, but well, it's easy to see merit on member's profile, I guess, merit is easy to get but doesn't come easily with this kind of thread. This is your first topic, if you want to earn merit, you must be productive in terms of helpful posts and replies to other members in the forum. Learning never ends, even in these forums where knowledge is not determined by the rank of members. Although there are also a lot of high-ranking memebers that are very knowledgeable about technology, Bitcoin technology, economics, politics, and other important stuff, perhaps if you are able to post with quality and any memeber or merit source finds your post helpful to them or other memebers in the forum, you can receive merit.At this point, OP, merit should not be your priority; this thread is far beyond mere curiosity; it seems like you have other hidden intentions. But what ever, well, every one here was once a newbie, with a few having gabs as their thread. As a newbie, I suggest you should be asking questions like, "How can I find my way around the forum?" Start by reading those thread suggestions from @tranthidung.You can also report some good merit worthy post to merit  source for you to receive merit but before then, you need to have quality post before you apply.[Merit] Share your best posts/threads with Fillippone to be merit assessed

comments.author: Dunamisx
comments.body: Quote from: Jimmycrooks on April 08, 2023, 01:14:00 PMHi guys, i'm a new user in this forum and I just wanna know, how do I get merits on my post. Is it just by writing or are there any other task involved.You earn merits base on the quality of what you post on the forum, anyone can decide to merit you or not base on how convinced or being touched they feels about what you have posted, you're not meant to beg for it or solicite for it, we have merit sources available on the forum saddled with the responsibility to do that, if i may advise you, learn to give out first before receiving, learn and have quality things to deliver, merits will come in later, but for now being a newbie, i think you need less to be concerned about merits than what to give or contribute.

comments.author: Odusko
comments.body: Quote from: Maus0728 on April 08, 2023, 02:16:02 PMJust be useful, articulate and make some sense!This comment makes a lot of sense to me, because being useful to other is the only way to get merits here in the forum since merits is not a commodity that is sold in the market place you must have to work to earn otherwise forget about it so long as the forum members did not fine your contributions useful it may be hard to get rewarded with merits.But once you are useful and share quality information the ops will be good to go, with time the rewards for those contributions will start rolling in.

comments.author: Pmalek
comments.body: You don't walk into a world-famous company and ask how to become a General Manager, get a company vehicle, and a six-figure salary. You are at the beginning of your journey. You are at the bottom of the pyramid. If this is, in fact, your first journey here. Your focus should be on learning how the forum works and what it is that we do here. We discuss and share knowledge about Bitcoin, how to use it, where, how, and why. Once you reach a point where you can take part in such discussions, understand them, and share your own experiences, that's when your merit count will start increasing.   What do you know about Bitcoin? Do you own any? Do you play to buy/earn some?How do you know about merits (as a new user), and what are you going to use them for?

comments.author: lovesmayfamilis
comments.body: OP, if you're observant after reading a number of threads, your merit fishing may be successful. There are several threads on the forum where merit is given away almost "for free", I won't give you links, but I know users who are very cunning in this matter; they literally live and guard such threads.Examples include baking a pie, carving a pumpkin, creating drawings, discussing SBF-Ross Ulbricht, and answering quizzes, although the latter is more difficult. Another thing is if you hunt for merit, but you are not a diligent reader, and then the creator of good posts, all your merits will not be worth anything, since your desire to earn extra money (and this is exactly what you obviously want) will become a pipe dream.Make a choice.

OP understands what he needs to progress, and therefore, has a chance to achieve what he wants. If will be active.Here is something similar where he can participate with drawing skills, and also earn extra money if have a talent for creating avatars - Whirlwind.money | Avatar Contest | Create avatars and win BTC | Ends May 7th!

comments.author: Yawa2020
comments.body: There is no need to worry about merit at the moment. Merit will look for you when you do the needful in the forum. How do you do the needful? It's simple! Make quality posts that are educative and helpful to the forum members, offer helpful comments on other people's post. However, while trying to be helpful, please abstain from plagiarism as it is a serious offense in this forum that will lead to temp or perm ban. I can see you've been offered some links to forum rules and all you need to know in the previous comments. Go through those threads and read in order to familiar yourself with the forum. You'll be surprised seeing merits following you if you stick to the forum ethics.

comments.author: Hyphen(-)
comments.body: Hello and welcome to the Bitcointalk forum. Jimmycrooks, we are delighted to have you here in this wonderful forum, and we all wish you a wonderful learning and interaction experience because I am confident you are in the right place to learn so much about Bitcoin and cryptocurrency in general.Quote from: Jimmycrooks on April 08, 2023, 01:14:00 PMHi guys, i'm a new user in this forum and I just wanna know, how do I get merits on my post. Is it just by writing or are there any other task involved.As a new user in the forum, I believe you should focus on the forum's importance and go through the forum rules and regulations before requesting to know how to get merits; although it's not a bad idea to be hungry for merits at first, you should be calm and study the forum first.Nonetheless, there are several ways to earn merit in this forum, which can be broadly classified as the quality of your responses and interactions in the forum.- Making quality and educative posts- Given correct and appropriate answers to a question asked in the forum- Sharing useful information in the forum that helps the forum members.

comments.author: nakamura12
comments.body: Learning on how to make good/high quality post is needed in order for you to post good/high quality posts which many people will find it helpful especially those who are still at learning phase. Sharing knowledge or information that haven't shared on this forum would also help you receive merit. Anyway, don't focus too much on earning merit. If you do all those things then merit will come on your way without thinking too much about how to get merit. Not to make someone affected or being criticized by me but asking for merits is already kind of having a negative side which most likely won't get merited. I suggest you make research yourself and then ask here later on.
